answers.answer: Hi!If it is indeed Staph infection then you need to ask doctor if it is MRSA—this infection can persist for years and needs rigorous treatment. Other than this, you need to get blood sugar tested as diabetes too can cause an infection to persist. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

Symptoms at present areDaytime urine frequency - every 1 hourNight urine frequency- onceUrge to go urine even after emptying the bladderReduced flowWeaknessThe initial diagnostic tests done are :-blood sugarurine analysisUriflowmetryUrine culture and sensitivity testSemen culture and sensitivity testAbove all test results are negativeNow after antibiotics the present doctor prefers following testsUrodynamic testDiagnostic cystoscopyplease help

question: hey doc,since 8 years i am experiencing frequent urination with no pain at lower abdominal area.at every 30-45 min.in day i need to urinate, but at night only once.i am on medicine since 4 months below are the medicine which doctor prescribed but no effects :-1. Urotel 4 mg2. soliten 4 mg3. alfu tabletnow at last visit ,from semen culture test STAPHYLOCOCCUS AREOUS  infection found for which he gave me :-1.Tamlet 4 mg    (tolterodine tartarate )2. clavox 625      ( amoxycillin clavulanate)3. Bectrim          ( trimethoprim and sulphamethoxazole )Is my treatment going in right direction or not ?am i living with this bacteria since 8 years ,is it possible ?
title: urine frequency
